summary:
The ocelot is a medium-sized wild cat found in North, Central, and South America. It has spots and measures about 16-20 inches tall at the shoulder, weighing between 15-34 pounds. These cats are excellent climbers, swimmers, and hunters, mainly eating small mammals. They are mostly active at night and live alone in their territory. Ocelots can have babies twice a year, and their young stay with their mother for up to two years.

Although they are not currently at risk, ocelots face threats from habitat loss, hunting, and road accidents. People have kept them as pets since ancient times.
title: Ocelot
